newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon tries Japanese Red Army suspects.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon tries Japanese Red Army suspects.

text.p: Five suspected Japanese Red Army guerrillas went on trial on Monday on charges of passport forgery and illegal entry to Lebanon that carry possible sentences of up to 10 years jail.

Kazua Tohira, Haruo Wako, Mariko Yamamoto, Masao Adachi and Kozo Okamoto were arrested on February and Japan expressed hopes they would be extradited to face international charges arising from guerrilla activity.
However, Lebanon at first denied holding them and then charged them with relatively minor offences which ensured they could not be extradited.
Lebanese acupuncturist Umayya Abboud, who was arrested with the five, went on trial simultaneously on charges of illegally practicing medicine.
Abboud was originally accused of helping the alleged guerrillas forge Lebanese documents but the accusation was later dropped.
